decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of counterspells, board wipes, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Dovin's Veto, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain a dominant position on the battlefield. The companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, provides additional utility and synergy with the deck's creature cards. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around outlasting the opponent and gradually taking over the game with powerful spells and efficient removal options.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of sacrificing creatures for value and dealing direct damage to the opponent. Utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven for a recurring sacrifice engine, along with Mayhem Devil to punish the opponent for each sacrifice. The inclusion of cards like Fatal Push and Claim the Firstborn provide removal and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain a steady stream of threats and disruption throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent efficiently. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to maintain constant pressure on the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Experimental Synthesizer allows for additional card draw and flexibility in adapting to different board states. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around aggressive plays and efficient use of resources to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive spells and creatures. The deck includes cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to deal damage early on, while cards like Reckless Rage and Cori-Steel Cutter offer removal options for opponent's threats. The deck also has a strong synergistic theme with cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Experimental Synthesizer to help maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to be fast-paced and efficient in dealing damage to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to constantly search for and play powerful creatures and enchantments to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of creatures with strong abilities and powerful enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By sacrificing lower-cost creatures and enchantments to search for higher-cost ones, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish a dominant board presence. The diverse range of cards allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups and situations, making it a versatile and unpredictable deck to play against.

The main concept of the UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear, while using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to remove opposing threats. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent by dealing direct damage and controlling the board with cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics. Utilizing cards like Monstrous Rage and Stormchaser's Talent can help to push through extra damage and close out the game swiftly, while maintaining a strong board presence with creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Emberheart Challenger.

The main focus of this aggro UR deck is to quickly play low-cost creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The deck includes a mix of creatures with prowess abilities and burn spells to control the board and push damage through. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent, using efficient spells and creatures to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to create a control-based strategy. The deck includes a variety of counter spells like Dovin's Veto and board wipes like Supreme Verdict to control the game. Cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge provide card advantage and disruption for the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Restless Anchorage and Field of Ruin to manage the opponent's resources. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through a combination of counter spells, board wipes, and card advantage.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is centered around quickly overwhelming your opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on applying pressure early in the game using cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear, while also having access to efficient removal options like Burst Lightning and Abrade. The deck also incorporates versatile cards like Stock Up and Academic Dispute to maintain card advantage and adapt to different situations. By combining aggressive creatures with direct damage spells, this deck aims to close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by playing low-cost creatures with prowess and utilizing burn spells to clear the way or finish off the opponent. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently while maintaining a consistent board presence. Using a combination of creatures with prowess abilities and burn spells, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory before they have a chance to stabilize. By utilizing a mix of creatures and spells, the deck can adapt to different situations and maintain a strong offensive presence throughout the game.

This deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive start while also having the ability to generate card advantage with Collected Company. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy while also providing the necessary colors for the deck. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent in order to secure a victory.

Utilizing cheap spells and cantrips to quickly fill up the graveyard and bring back Arclight Phoenix for constant pressure on the opponent. The deck focuses on casting spells to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability and control the board while also drawing cards to maintain card advantage. It also includes removal spells to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, overwhelming the opponent with a stream of threats and efficient spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruption spells to apply pressure on the opponent and control the board. By combining powerful Aggro creatures like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben with cards like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to ensure smooth and consistent access to the necessary colors, while the inclusion of Elspeth, Storm Slayer provides an additional win condition and resilience against removal spells.

The main focus of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and controlling the board with powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Preacher of the Schism. With a mix of removal, hand disruption, and powerful threats, the deck aims to out value and outlast its opponent by taking control of the game and setting the pace. The deck also includes a blend of utility lands and spells to ensure consistency and adaptability in various matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Lotus Field and utilizing cards like Scapeshift and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods to generate powerful combo plays. The deck also includes support cards like Arboreal Grazer and Port of Karfell to help set up the combo pieces. The goal is to efficiently cycle through the deck and assemble the necessary cards to overwhelm the opponent with a big play, taking advantage of the synergy between the different cards in the deck.

The deck focuses on the aggressive strategy of using creatures like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition to quickly overwhelm opponents. It also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to cast powerful spells like Collected Company and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts opponents' strategies while cards like Abandoned Air Temple and Boseiju, Who Endures provide utility and protection. The deck aims to maintain early pressure and tempo to secure a swift victory while also having resilience and control options to handle opposing threats.
